pageTitle: Best Financial Advisors in New Brunswick
metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in New Brunswick. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Jonathan Barrett CFP®, CLU®, ChFC®, RICP®, RPS®

heroDescription: New Brunswick, NJ, is a vibrant city known for its rich history and diverse economy.
landscapeDescription: Home to Rutgers University, New Brunswick boasts a strong educational sector alongside healthcare and technology industries. The city's economy is bolstered by its strategic location between New York City and Philadelphia.
uniqueNeeds: Focus on educational services, healthcare access, and tech innovation.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: New Brunswick's tech and healthcare concentration poses risks; monitor real estate fluctuations and potential flooding. Diversify investments to mitigate economic downturns.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), New Brunswick's economy is growing steadily, driven by education and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in New Brunswick is $65,000, reflecting a diverse economic base.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in New Brunswick are increasingly focusing on healthcare and education sectors.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), the cost of living in New Brunswick is slightly above the national average, driven by housing costs.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the real estate market in New Brunswick shows signs of appreciation, raising concerns about a potential bubble.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), New Brunswick's business climate is favorable, particularly for startups in tech and healthcare.
